intro: Conicosia muirii, commonly known as the Muir's conicosia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils. The leaves are usually opposite and have a velvety texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
